allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Initial commit: Human history Obsidian vault with economic emphasis

Comprehensive knowledge base spanning Prehistory to Early Modern era:

- Prehistory: Miocene through Neolithic, tool industries, human evolution
- Ancient: Mesopotamia, Egypt, Indus Valley, China, Greece, Rome, Persia, Americas
- Medieval: Islamic world, Song China, Europe, Mongols, major cities
- Early Modern: Atlantic economy, Industrial Revolution
- Thematic: Economic origins, convergence, collapse, persistence, Great Divergence

All civilizations at consistent depth with economy notes, key sites, key figures.
Cross-linked for Obsidian graph navigation.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(for name in "Mesopotamia Index" "Egypt Index" "Pleistocene Epoch" "Venice" "Medieval Europe Economy" "Upper Paleolithic" "Sumer" "Inca Empire" "Uruk" "Hanseatic League" "Baghdad" "Neolithic Revolution")
Bash(for dir in "01 - Prehistory" "02 - Ancient" "03 - Medieval" "04 - Early Modern" "05 - Modern" "06 - Contemporary" "Themes")

Bash(for file in "Age of Exploration" "American Revolution" "Atlantic Economy" "Atlantic Slave Trade" "British Empire Economy" "Cotton Economy" "Dutch Golden Age" "East India Companies" "Hamilton''s Financial System" "Industrial Revolution" "Lunar Society" "Ming Dynasty" "Ottoman Economy" "Portuguese Empire" "Qing China Economy" "Silver Economy" "Spanish Empire Economy" "Steam Engine" "Sugar Economy" "Timber Crisis" "Tokugawa Japan Economy" "Westward Expansion")

Bash(for link in "Origins of Economy" "Industrial Revolution" "Mass Production" "Globalization" "Property Rights" "Taxation" "Steam Engine" "Mathematical Economics" "Marxist Economics" "Keynesian Economics" "Austrian Economics" "Neo-classical Economics")
